alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson County; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 19 at 3:39PM MDT until May 19 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning Continues Through This Evening... .Red Flag Warning continues for the entire area through this evening due to gusty winds and low RH values. A wind shift is still anticipated this evening affecting the northern counties first as it moves southeast. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT /9 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 001...002...003...004...013...014...015...016...027...028...029... 041...042...079...080...081...252...253 AND 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado...Fire Weather Zone 252 Yuma... Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas...Fire Weather Zone 001 Cheyenne...Fire Weather Zone 002 Rawlins...Fire Weather Zone 003 Decatur... Fire Weather Zone 004 Norton...Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman... Fire Weather Zone 014 Thomas...Fire Weather Zone 015 Sheridan...Fire Weather Zone 016 Graham...Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace...Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan...Fire Weather Zone 029 Gove...Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. In Nebraska...Fire Weather Zone 079 Dundy...Fire Weather Zone 080 Hitchcock and Fire Weather Zone 081 Red Willow. * Timing...Late this morning through sunset this evening. * Winds...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Temperatures...In the lower 90s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised. * Additional Information...An abrupt northerly wind shift is anticipated to occur around sunset this evening along and north of the Kansas/Nebraska border, continuing southward through the remainder of the area this evening. Northerly winds will increase to 30 to 40 mph immediately after the wind shift, persist for an hour or two, then quickly weaken to 10 to 20 mph. First responders fighting any fires should keep in contact with the National Weather Service in Goodland regarding the timing of the wind shift, associated with a cold front.
info.instruction: Outdoor burning is not advised. Repeating, outdoor burning is not advised today. Any fires that start may rapidly grow and spread out of control.
